{{Infobox Given Name Revised | name = Juan | image= | imagesize= | caption= | pronunciation= | gender = Male | meaning = | region = | origin = | related names = Juana, John, Jon, Jose | footnotes = }} '''Juan''' ({{{pronounced|ˈxwan}}}) is a [[Spanish language|Spanish]] form of the [[given name]] [[John (name)|John]] (q.v.). It was the 55th most popular name in the [[United States]] [[as of 2003]]. Like all of the other cognates in various languages in the John article it is derived from the Hebrew Jehohannon (God is gracious). It is also commonly found in the [[Isle of Man]], where it has a different pronunciation.
The feminine form is [[Juana]] or [[Juanita]].
==Juan==
